intro: Maripa densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered maripa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in humid and warm climates. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
